content.text:
# List of wars involving Bosnia and Herzegovina

This is a list of wars involving Bosnia and Herzegovina and its predecessor states.
Medieval Bosnia

|-
!style="background:#001489" width="170px"|Conflict
!style="background:#001489" width="190px"|Combatant 1

|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Bosnian Crusade(1235–1241)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Victory
* Status quo ante bellum
* Hungarian conquest stopped after First Mongol invasion of Hungary
* Hungarian occupation of peripheral parts of Bosnia reversed after the war
|-
|style="background:#efefef"|
War of Hum (1326–1329)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Victory
*Bosnia captures Hum
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Bosnian-Serbian war(1350-1351)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Victory
* After a failed siege of Bobavc Bosnia regains Hum
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Partition of Altomanović(1373)
|style="background:#efefef"|   Moravian Serbia
|style="background:#efefef"|Nikola Altomanović
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Victory
*Bosnia gains most of Raška
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Ottoman conquest of Bosnia and Herzegovina(1386–1592)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#FFD0D0"| Defeat
* Incorporation of Bosnia and Herzegovina into the Ottoman Empire
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Bosnian–Ragusan war(1403–1404)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#FFD0D0"| Defeat
* Retreat of the Bosnian Army after Ragusans set fire to Šumet and Žrnovnica
|}
Ottoman Bosnia

|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Hundred Years' Croatian–Ottoman War (1527–1593)
|style="background:#efefef"|
*  Eyalet of Bosnia
|style="background:#efefef"|
*  Kingdom of Croatia
*  Kingdom of Hungary
*  Duchy of Carniola
*  Serbian Despotate
| style="background:#E0D0FF" |Inconclusive
*Ottoman Empire conquered areas of Kingdom of Croatia between Vrbas river and Kupa river. Their advance was conclusively halted in 1593 in Third Battle of Sisak. The remaining land remained under the control of Kingdom of Croatia.
*Kingdom of Croatia reduced to "Remnants of the remnants"
*Croatia joins Habsburg Monarchy
*Formation of Military Frontier
*Start of the Long Turkish War
|-
| style="background:#efefef" | Serb Uprising in Herzegovina of 1596–1597(1596–1597)
| style="background:#efefef" |
* Serb Rebels
** Bjelopavlići
** Drobnjaci
** Nikšići
** Pivljani
| style="background:#efefef" |
| style="background:#FFD0D0" | Defeat
* Rebellion suppressed by the Ottoman Empire
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Austro-Turkish War (1663–1664)
|style="background:#efefef"|
*  Eyalet of Bosnia
|style="background:#efefef"|
*
*
*
*
*
Kingdom of Croatia
Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Victory
*The Ottomans retain Oradea in Transylvania and gain Nové Zámky from the Kingdom of Hungary
*Construction of a Habsburg fort along the Waag river, and granted a twenty-year truce.
|-
| style="background:#efefef" | Croatian-Slavonian-Dalmatian theater in the Great Turkish War (1684–1699)
| style="background:#efefef" |
*  Eyalet of Bosnia
| style="background:#efefef" | Habsburg Monarchy
*  Kingdom of Croatia
Republic of Venice
| style="background:#FFD0D0" | Defeat
* Liberation of Slavonia and Lika and part of the Pounje from the Ottomans
*Ottoman Empire pushed out of Central Europe
|-
| style="background:#efefef" | Austro-Turkish War (1716–1718)
| style="background:#efefef" |
*  Eyalet of Bosnia
| style="background:#efefef" |
*  Serbian Militia
*  Duchy of Württemberg
*
*
* Hajduks
* Serbian rebels
| style="background:#FFD0D0" | Defeat
* Treaty of Passarowitz
*Banat, Serbia, Oltenia and portions of northern Bosnia were ceded to the Habsburgs
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Battle of Banja Luka (1737)
|style="background:#efefef"|
*
|style="background:#efefef"|  Austria
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Victory

|-

* Serb Rebels
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#FFD0D0"| Defeat

|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#FFD0D0"| Defeat
* Rebellion suppressed by the Ottoman Empire
* Herzegovina Eyalet was seceded from Bosnia Eyalet
* Ayan system was abolished

Austro-Hungarian Bosnia and Herzegovina
{| class="wikitable"
|-
!style="background:#001489" width="170px"|Conflict
!style="background:#001489" width="190px"|Combatant 1

|-
|style="background:#efefef"| World War I(1914–1918)
|style="background:#efefef"|
*
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#FFD0D0"| Defeat
* End of the German, Russian, Ottoman, and Austro-Hungarian empires
* Formation of new countries in Europe and the Middle East
* Transfer of German colonies and regions of the former Ottoman Empire to other powers
* Establishment of the League of Nations
* Incorporation of Bosnia and Herzegovina into the State of Slovenes, Croats and Serbs (later renamed Yugoslavia)
|}
Yugoslav Bosnia and Herzegovina

|-
!style="background:#001489" width="170px"|Conflict

|style="background:#efefef"| Husino Rebellion(1920)
|style="background:#efefef"|  Miners
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#E0D0FF"| Defeat
* Rebellion suppressed
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| World War II(1941–1945)
|style="background:#efefef"|
*  Bosnian and Herzegovinian Partisans
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Victory
* Collapse of the German Reich
* Fall of Japanese and Italian Empires
* Creation of the United Nations
* Emergence of the United States and the Soviet Union as superpowers
* Beginning of the Cold War
* Bosnia becomes a part of SFRY Yugoslavia as the Socialist Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Cazin Rebellion(1950)
|style="background:#efefef"|
* Civilians
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#FFD0D0"| Defeat
* Rebellion suppressed
|}
Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina
{| class="wikitable"
|-
!style="background:#001489" width="170px"|Conflict
!style="background:#001489" width="190px"|Combatant 1
!style="background:#001489" width="190px"|Combatant 2
!style="background:#001489" width="320px"|Result
|-
| style="background:#efefef" | Bosnian War(1992–1995)
| style="background:#efefef" |
| style="background:#efefef" |
| style="background:#E0D0FF" | Stalemate
* Internal partition of Bosnia and Herzegovina according to the Dayton Accords
* Over 101,000 dead, mainly Bosniaks
* First genocide in Europe since World War II
* Deployment of NATO-led forces to oversee the peace agreement
* Establishment of the Office of the High Representative to oversee the civilian implementation of the peace agreement
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| 1992 Yugoslav campaign in Bosnia(1992)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"|  Yugoslavia
|style="background:#FFD0D0"| Defeat
*Republika Srpska formed as a separate Serb state from Bosnia
*TOBiH and HV eliminated from Foča, Višegrad, Prijedor, Ilidža, Zvornik, Kupres, Doboj, Brčko, Bijeljina, Bosanski Šamac and more
*Establishment of the VRS
*The JNA leaves Bosnia due to agreements with the UN and were replaced by the VRS
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Croat–Bosniak War(1992–1994)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#E0D0FF"| Stalemate
* Washington Agreement
* Creation of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Intra-Bosnian Muslim War(1993–1995)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Victory
* AP Western Bosnia got abolished.
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Croatian War of Independence(1994–1995)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Victory
* Yugoslav army formally withdrew from Croatia from January 1992 under the Sarajevo Agreement
* Croatian forces regained control over most of Republic of Serbian Krajina-held territory
* Croatian forces advanced into Bosnia and Herzegovina to assist the united Bosnian and Croatian side, which led to the eventual end of the Bosnian War in December 1995
|}
Bosnia and Herzegovina
{| class="wikitable"
|-
!style="background:#001489" width="170px"|Conflict
!style="background:#001489" width="190px"|Combatant 1
!style="background:#001489" width="190px"|Combatant 2
!style="background:#001489" width="320px"|Result
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| War in Afghanistan(2001–2021)
|style="background:#efefef"|  ISAF
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
|style="background:#efefef"|  Taliban al-Qaeda
|style="background:#FFD0D0"| Withdrawal
* Overthrow of the Taliban-governed Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan, December 2001. Taliban continue in the form of an insurgency
* Establishment of the coalition-backed Islamic Republic of Afghanistan, January 2004
* Killing of Osama bin Laden in Pakistan, May 2011
* Gradual "Afghanization" of combat operations during drawdown of ISAF forces
* Doha Agreement (2020) between the United States and Taliban beginning withdrawal of United States-led forces, full withdrawal was completed by 30 August 2021
* 2021 Taliban offensive culminates in overthrow of the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan and end of fighting, 15 August 2021
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Iraq War(2003–2008)
|style="background:#efefef"|  Iraqi Kurdistan MNF–I
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
|style="background:#efefef"|  SCJL Naqshbandi Army
---- ISI
*  al-Qaeda
*  FIA
Ansar al-IslamIAI
---- Mahdi Army Special GroupsBadr Brigades Kata'ib Hezbollah
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Victory
* Invasion and occupation of Iraq
* Overthrow of Ba'ath Party government
* Execution of Saddam Hussein
* Emergence of significant insurgency, rise of al-Qaeda in Iraq
* Civil war between 2006 and 2008
* Subsequent reduction in violence and depletion of al-Qaeda in Iraq in 2008
* Establishment of parliamentary democracy and formation of new Shia-led government
* Withdrawal of US forces from Iraq in 2011
|}
